parts.text: I'll help you see what's new by checking recent blog posts and GitHub releases. Let me gather this information for you.

allBlogs.title: Why Cloud Development Environments Are Critical for Autonomous Driving Pioneers
allBlogs.description: Autonomous vehicle companies are using Coder to accelerate hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulations and test track engineering. These teams run real-time, embedded system development inside the vehicles themselves, often on remote test tracks where the car is the server.

allBlogs.title: Coder Brings Governance to Kiro IDE with Centralized MCP
allBlogs.description: With Coder’s Kiro integration, configure MCP servers directly into template code, adding organization-specific context — no login delays, no workflow disruptions.

allBlogs.title: Auggie CLI Agent Now Available in Coder Tasks
allBlogs.description: The Auggie CLI agent from Augment Code is now officially supported and ready for use in Coder Tasks. This integration lets you run Auggie directly inside your Coder workspace, so you can automate common tasks like dependency updates, code scaffolding, or environment setup without leaving your IDE or moving code out of your secure environment.

allBlogs.title: Coder Delivers Fast, Consistent MCP Tooling for Cursor
allBlogs.description: Enterprises are racing to adopt AI. Cursor IDE is most effective with Model Context Protocol (MCP). With Coder, you can pre-configure MCP in workspace templates so devs get a golden path from day one—while IT keeps control with IaC.

allBlogs.title: Inside AI Adoption: Lessons from Enterprise Software Development Teams
allBlogs.description: AI tools are reshaping how enterprise development teams work, but success requires more than just deploying the latest assistants. Drawing from our work with Fortune 500 companies and other enterprise customers, we've identified key lessons around what works when adopting AI in enterprise software development.

allBlogs.title: Rethink Everything: Why Windows 11 Is a Strategic Gift
allBlogs.description: Microsoft's Windows 11 hardware requirements aren't just breaking budgets — they're creating the perfect opportunity to rethink your entire development strategy. While most teams scramble to buy compliant laptops, forward-thinking leaders are asking a different question: What if this forced migration is actually permission to go cloud-native?

allBlogs.title: Query-Mutating Data Race in Go: Hiding in Plain Sight
allBlogs.description: Coder’s engineering team has discovered a serious security vulnerability in the Go standard libary `database/sql` package. As of writing there are no known exploits against any applications, but we recommend updating to Go version 1.24.6 immediately and upgrading all Coder deployments to a patched release.

allBlogs.title: How AI Agents Are Redefining Developer Workflows at Anthropic
allBlogs.description: On July 30th, we hosted a fireside chat with leaders from Anthropic's product and developer experience team who is building Claude Code to explore how AI coding agents are reshaping development workflows. Here are the highlights.

allBlogs.title: Is the IDE Dead? The Rise of Agentic AI in Software Development
allBlogs.description: The IDE will not be the center of the developer universe. AI-powered editors like Cursor and Windsurf are a stop on the AI tour, not the destination. The future is chatting with an agent.

allBlogs.title: Day 5: Composable by Design – What will you build? + Launch Week Recap
allBlogs.description: The Coder Registry is a growing marketplace for secure, enterprise-ready modules — built to share, remix, and accelerate innovation across teams.

parts.text:
Here's what's new at Coder:

## 📝 Latest Blog Content

### Recently Published
1. **[Why Cloud Development Environments Are Critical for Autonomous Driving Pioneers](https://coder.com/blog/why-cloud-development-environments-are-critical-for-autonomous-driving-pioneers)** *(September 8, 2025)*
   - Author: Eric Paulsen
   - Focus: How autonomous vehicle companies use Coder for hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulations and real-time embedded system development

2. **[Auggie CLI Agent Now Available in Coder Tasks](https://coder.com/blog/auggie-cli-agent-now-available-in-coder-tasks)** *(August 29, 2025)*
   - Author: M Atif Ali
   - Integration with Augment Code's Auggie CLI agent for automating tasks like dependency updates and code scaffolding

3. **[Coder Delivers Fast, Consistent MCP Tooling for Cursor](https://coder.com/blog/ship-fast-and-consistent-mcp-tooling-for-cursor)** *(August 20, 2025)*
   - Author: M Atif Ali
   - Pre-configuring Model Context Protocol (MCP) in workspace templates for Cursor IDE

### In Draft
- **Coder Brings Governance to Kiro IDE with Centralized MCP** *(Draft)*
  - Author: Suman Bisht
  - Upcoming: Kiro integration with centralized MCP server management

## 🔥 Key Themes

The latest content shows Coder's focus on:
- **AI Integration**: Multiple posts about MCP tooling, AI agents, and enterprise AI adoption
- **Industry Specialization**: Autonomous driving and specialized use cases
- **Enterprise Governance**: Centralized management and security for AI tooling
- **Security**: Recent Go vulnerability disclosure and patching

**Total Blog Posts**: 261 posts in the system
